title: Using Data Mining Techniques to Address Critical Information Exchange Needs in Disaster Affected Public-Private Networks

author: Li Zheng, School of Computing and Information Science, Florida International University

segmentation: My name is Jenny.
I'm from Florida International University and we have two other PhD students working in this project.
There are some talented young, so the title of my presentation is using data mining techniques to address critical information exchange needs in disaster affected public private networks.

As we all know that some major natural disasters such as hurricanes or earthquakes or some man made disasters cause a lot of damage is and property losses around the world, and the study shows that nearly 40% of the companies failed within 30 six months when they were closed for three or more days.
As a result of the hurricane.
So this is many becausw that there are many questions and the companies should face in after being affected by the.
Hurricane such as what's accounts, damage, situations of the company's facilities, or is the basic business operating environment available at this time?
Or other our customers or the suppliers are ready to do businesses.
Without answers to those kind of questions, it's hard for the companies to make a sound decision to restart their businesses.
However, currently there is no single solution or techniques that can help people to answer those kind of questions, so our project.
Attempts to provide a communication network and provide high quality recovery information and facilitate the collaborations between the business and government particip
So in general, the business continuity information network system, which we call Beacon for short.

Is a platform of information sharing, integration, extraction and precision and also it's a data mining solution for disaster management and recovery, including the process analysis, the data from diverse sources with different formats, and also it's an integration of the advanced technologies involving the literal language processing database.
Data mining.
So here's the overview of the Beacon system on the top of the interface we would see the dashboard, which is the snapshot of the important informations and updating formations in our system.

We could see that the informations were categorised by different industries and also it can categorised by the geographic errors and different symbols in this in this table indicating the corresponding status of the services.
And this is the report list of the system.
It shows the update or the recent submitted reports, and in another view it can show the summarized content of a recent reports.
In the reporting tab, this is the interface for the users to submit the reports.
They can submit the report through the forms we provided in the system and also they can upload the files direct directly to our system.
So from our observations of the using of the system, we have identified several challenges to using our system to apply on our system.
And we have already figured out for important components that can handle those kind of problems.
The information extraction, multi document summarization and dynamic dashboard.
The finally we perform community generation.
So we have already integrated those four components into our system framework and we from this framework we can see that the data of our systems comes from different sources.
They can come from the business to business community, or they can also comes from the Emergency Operational Center, which is the official center to handle the disaster recovery phases.
And also it can comes from the public organizations and the government services.
So the data the data is in our system can be represented as four as different as the entities such as the reports, the messages, the services, or even the orders such as the curfews.
So for the unformatted data inputs we were using the information extraction component to generate the entity relation and relations in our system.
Then by using the already existing database records an index report files, we will use the document summarization component to get a summarized content of the recent submitted reports.
And also we can we have a recommendation engine that can provide the update content based on the users.
Preferences and finally we have the spatial clustering techniques to generate dynamic communities that will help the recommendation engine to capture the users preference.
Now for the information extraction component, it deal with the massive sources at granularities and also different level of redundancies.
So the the different variety shows that the input of the of this component will be structured and unstructured documents or the Maria.

So in this part we will use the dynamic dashboard to provide a personalized and snapshot of the update information that the user was user prefers.

So how to reduce the redundancy of those documents or how to rank on the relevance to the users?
To reduce the in order to reduce the redundancy, we simply perform a document clustering methods.
Based on the cosine distance on each pair of the documents and just use the each center of the clusters to rank the rella.

For the content ranking.

So for incoming document, the score of this document will be calculated by the similarity between the incoming document and the users preference dot product by the priority of the document.
So in our system the priority of a document was divided into, divided into 3 levels.
The highest level is the document summarized by the.
Submitted by the government and the middle level is the document submitted by the by those companies reside in the users community and the lowest level is the other documents.
The next come the next component is the excuse me report summarization it dealing with the multiple reports and also the unstructured and structured information.

The community in our system is dynamic.
It's based on the status of the business relationships between the companies or the status of the companies themselves.
And also it's highly depend on the how we divide those.
Regions there's a two constraints we considered in our in our implementation.

The first is obstacle which cut the connection between two sites in the graph an even if these two sides are are very close, such as the road forbidden to enter or the curfew errors, and the other one is the facilitators which can establish the connection between the.
Between two far regions.

It doesn't make much sense to her and to help the help.
